website_summaries.verdict: These durable boots are a great choice for more casual hiking outings and trail running.
pros: Updated version of a popular pair
Frequently praised for its Vibram sole, which keeps feet pain-free and comfortable over the miles
cons: Boots feel stiff during the break-in period
Some wearers found the high arch support uncomfortable

customer_reviews.title: I Finally Got to Tell Her, "I Told You So"
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these for a recent trip to the mountains of Peru. She originally wanted different, waterproof boots, but, as a former paratrooper with global service, I stubbornly insisted that she get this boot instead. She works outdoors in Florida at an animal sanctuary and now wears them every day. She loved them in Peru and had no complaints; from wet tropical forest, to rocky steppes, to high altitude climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: BEST Hiking Boots for tricky feet.... on my second pair!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the most comfortable hiking boots I have ever owned...I"m on my second pair! If you have foot "issues", these are the perfect boot by Merrell. Obviously, Merrell makes many other models, but I've found THIS MODEL is the best for Plantar Fasciitis, arch support, heel pain, and general foot support. These are the one and only shoe that I can wear for HOURS without my feet hurting. I've gone many miles without foot issues, and they have EXCELLENT breathability. I was recommended these initially by a random stranger in REI. Thank God I listened....so now I'm paying it forward because these are truly the best boots!
customer_reviews.author: D'Anna Watson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, breathable.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought and returned several hiking boots. Tried on over 30 pairs. Wides, normal width, 9, 9.5, and 10’s. I have wide feet and had surgery at a bunion site to remove a calcium deposit about 10 years ago. Since then my foot is swollen at that bunion site and I have a hard time finding shoes that don’t rub there. These boots are perfect. No rubbing, comfortable and breathable. I am considering getting another pair for work as I stand and walk long hours on my feet indoors. I will definitely buy more!!!
customer_reviews.author: Toaster

customer_reviews.title: Immediately comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with these hiking boots. The last time I bought hiking boots from a sporting goods store, they were so hard and stiff, I could never get use to them. These are very sturdy, but not uncomfortable, even on the first mile and a half hike, even with the foot problem I'm currently having (either Achilles tendonitis or plantar fasciitis -- undiagnosed). I was thrilled! I'd recommend these shoes, and I'm sure they aren't over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Kat B.

customer_reviews.title: great boots
customer_reviews.text: I just took my first small hike in these boots today and was very satisfied with them. They fit great and gave me plenty of support. I have weak ankles and bad feet in general, so they were a welcome addition to my hike! I bought the size that I usually wear in sneakers, to allow for my feet to expand somewhat with long walks, and it worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: emmapeel

customer_reviews.title: Buy them if you have foot problems
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic boots! I have bone on bone damage in my ankles and these help stabilize my ankles and lessen the excruciating pain a little. I ordered one half size up so I can wear thick smart wool socks and possibly custom orthotics. The insole is a little stiff/hard but overall these are great. I ordered wide and they’re perfect
customer_reviews.author: brenda Wright

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and supportive!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: they are not waterproof:( out hiking in the PNW means flooded trails with lots of mud and puddles. My feet stay mostly dry but some water does get in where the sole and top material meet. I am going to try using a water proof spray on them to see if that helps. I am so beyond happy with these. I am not a huge fan of the look of these so I resisted for a while. I trued 4 other hiking boots out and these are hands down the most comfortable. They fit perfectly, I was looking for lots of toe room with good arch and heal support and these check all the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy L.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Wore these the first time with Merrel wool crew socks and loved them! Hiked all day long and could have kept going! They were very comfortable and light weight! I have tired sensitive feet and am very particular about fit and comfort. They ran true to size. I absolutely love these hiking boots and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I have had 2 major low back fusions in the last 25 years with the most recent in Sept 2017 and I'm still healing. I have several screws, rods and a spacer implanted in my back. I wear these on hikes. The traction on these shoes is very good. I have very little slippage with these shoes when hiking on graveled trails. They help me stay active which is very important to healing.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma B

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for arthritic toes
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pair of hiking boots that would accommodate feet/ toe problems due to arthritis. Tried a pair of these boots in a medium width in the store and with heavier socks it was uncomfortable. Ordered the wide width and have ample room in the toe box, making them much more comfortable to wear. Looking forward to hiking now, rather than dreading it due to pain. I do use a specialized arch support and will likely need to put them into these boots, but that is normal for me. I also love the purple addition to the boots that adds a bit of a feminine touch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Severely disppointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge Merrell fan. Love my previous boots. This one was much larger than my previous hiking boot. Not sure if it's because this is "vented" material, but definitely does not provide the support I was expecting or have experienced in the past. The boot is "floppy", looks and feels more like a slipper, which is fine except when trekking in the white mountains. After a serious hike, my foot was blistered on the bottom because I could not get the boot tight enough so it kept slipping on my foot. Used the same socks as I do with my previous boots.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Jo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible on mud, snow and rocks. Not for serious/through hikers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a section of the PCT. The tread on these are terrible. I slid on every surpass excerpt soft forest floor. These boots slid twice as much as everyone else in my group. My tail runners would have done better. These boots also have no rock plate over the ball of the foot leaving it unprotected from rocks. Bottom line, this shoe is great for short, easy day hikes. Anything more technical, stead clear.
customer_reviews.author: Partyof7plus1

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really liked these but they don't seem to work for my feet. I ordered a wide and they were just the right width and length per the size. I kept trying them around the house and my feet just did not feel right esp the right shoe. They felt comfortable at first but my feet would just start to ache after a little while. I think perhaps the arch support was too high for my flatish feet? I even added memory foam soles but still the same. I think these a good shoes but not right for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: momtokippy

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I have never paid this much for a pair of shoes. But these are worth more than I paid as far as I'm concerned. $109.00 is a great deal for this Merrel brand. I do a lot of hiking in the woods and these are great for every terrain. Plenty of support, not too heavy and because they are vented they keep your feet cool. Most comfortable boots I've ever owned. Comfortable right out of the box. Feel like they were broken in before you put them on the first time.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Feels like Heaven
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Merrell hiking boots before and have always loved them. I ordered this pair of Merrell and a pair of Keen hiking boots. It was a very tough decision over which pair to keep. I will be starting a new job at USPS where I will be on my feet 8 to 12 hours a day in all types of weather. I chose Keen over Merrell only because of the amount of rubber between the ground and the sides of the boot/soles of my feet. But these Merrells are fantastically comfortable. I wish that at this point in my life I needed a second pair of hiking boots... Then I would keep both!
customer_reviews.author: AbbeyOMy

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and not confortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with this product, hurts everywhere, really stiff, clunky and just took them for a trail walk got blisters in my big toes (both) immediately. Even when I'm not doing walking or heavy trailing, the boot is painful in the ankles, the upper foot, because they are hard and stiff. Can't wear them for long periods. Wanted to get another brand because after this experience with Merrel shoes, just makes me doubt all of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Celsa

customer_reviews.title: Best boots made !!
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Merrell boots love the vent mid ! Most comfortable boot ever from the first try on . The more you wear them the more comfortable they become ! They wear like iron ! Had my first pair for 8 years and they are still in the best shape ! Order a second for a color Change . I take a 9 1/2. In these boots I wear a 10. I would order a half size up !
customer_reviews.author: Jade 1219

customer_reviews.title: These are great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I always order Merrell shoes, boots, and sandals a half size larger. I wear a size 8, and I ordered an 8.5 for these hiking boots. These are great hiking boots! There is no breaking in required. I have hiked in them on five hikes--each hike has been 5-6 miles, up and down steep hills and over rocks. These boots are incredibly comfortable. I am just wearing regular socks (socks I purchased at Costco), nothing fancy. I love these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: 5.5 wide fits right glad didn't get a 6
customer_reviews.text: Prefect fix glad I didn't go with the suggestion to size up a half. Have always been 5.5 wide and these fit prefect
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support, comfort and fit - if you upsize by 1!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, and they came highly recommended by a friend who swore they were a perfect fit right out of the box. The first pair I ordered, my actual size 9, felt too narrow. I've never had wide feet, but maybe with my newfound love of hiking the last 6 months, they have gotten wider. I returned the 9's and went up a full size to a 10. Perfect!! They felt fantastic. I went for a 4 mile hike in varied terrain, and they were amazing. Sturdy, comfy, good grip on loose gravel. Worth every penny. I only wish there was a wider range of colors. Well done, Merrell!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are like clouds hugging my feet!
customer_reviews.text: I tried on at least 10 pairs of different brand hiking boots and shoes. I fell in love with these the moment I put my feet into them. It felt like a cloud was hugging my foot very gently from all sides. They are amazing. It’s definitely worth every penny for these hiking boots. They support your ankles as well as the rest of your feet!
customer_reviews.author: J Olson

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but the wide...
customer_reviews.text: Sent them back because the women’s wide was so big, I didn’t recognize those big feet down below. Like men’s shoes. If it wasn’t work to return them, I’d try the normal width. Although...shout out to Amazon and UPS stores for making it easier. (Still love the Post Office.) The shoes were admirably well made.
customer_reviews.author: Bea Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking boots.
customer_reviews.text: Good but minimum size up. My usual size is 10M. In this boots minimum 10,5 W. For me, these boots are very tough, since I need boots for long walks in cold weather, but not for high hiking.More for walking on paved roads. For these purposes, the shoes are hard and I put a special insole for walking, this made them softer but my feet hurt anyway. I do not recommend for long fast walking on the roads. Overall warm and sturdy boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: All the hikers recommend this shoe as a great starter shoe - can ...
customer_reviews.text: All the hikers recommend this shoe as a great starter shoe - can wear right out of the box - needs no breaking in. Wide enough for comfort and steady and light enough for moderate to rough terrains. Go to a sporting shop to get your right size. Your shoe size may be different than your hiking shoe size. And get the right width. For example: B is generally wider size, and you may have to select Wide, or BW, when you purchase your boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What was I doing without these?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t begin to describe how much I love these freakin boots! The break-in was a breeze, they are super comfy for all day wear, they give fantastic ankle support, and pretty good arch support too! The traction is also great— I feel super safe and secure when hiking on rocky terrain in these. I literally can’t think of a single thing I’d change about these boots. Looking forward to years of hikes in these :)
customer_reviews.author: Syracuse Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great Toe Room
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try Merrells after having a few pairs of Keen boots separate from the soles after not that much use. The Merrell boots seem to have a bit more length and toe room. The heel is not as narrow as the Keens. Support is about equivalent, quite good. I really like the boots so far, only time will tell if they will outlast Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Grace

customer_reviews.title: Love my new boots!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a 2 week fishing/hiking trip in Idaho. They fit perfectly right out of the box, no breaking in required. My feet tend to be wide, so was surprised they actually fit, note to those with narrow feet. The water resistance is awesome. I had waves splashing on my feet but they never absorbed the water. Light weight and comfortable to wear. Also like that they can breathe, which water proof boots don't provide. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: kellster0893

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected, color was as shown, great arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED!! ZappoDisappointed with the color
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this boot was correct except for the color. The order was very clear and the label on the confirmed the boots were supposed to be purple. However, the actual product was a pinkish orange. Did that happen at the factory or in the DC? Or perhaps whoever was fulfilling the order didn't bother to check the actual product to confirm the color was correct. Quote disappointed by this and contemplating returning for the correct color. .
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Superior comfort, no break in time necessary, went right to work!
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I put these on I knew they were perfect for me. I put miles on my shoes and wear them every day, not just an occasional hiker. I grow hay, irrigate, raise sheep and train working border collies. The best shoe ever. My prior boots were Keens and Ariats, these are far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was tight (right foot only). I've never had this problem and I've owned a lot of Merrell shoes. I can't hike more than 6 miles without my right toes hurting. 2nd irritant is that I can't walk through a low grass field without my socks - and by extension my feet - being soaked. If you are looking for a water proof shoe... search on. I'm going back to Keen.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Who Hikes

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe, light
customer_reviews.text: The reviews said order up , I did and it was too large . Overall , nice shoe, light, seemed comfortable and I’m going to return it for my normal size and see how it fits .
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!!! No breaking in required.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the reviews I read and my husband also owns the exact same pair of hiking boots. We both love them! Hiked 6 mile hikes in Colorado without breaking them in beforehand and they were very comfortable, no blisters or pain anywhere. I did size up half a size which I recommend if your plan to wear proper hiking socks.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ferrante

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stable boots
customer_reviews.text: I came back for a second pair of these boots. They are very comfortable and do not require a break in period. I bought up a size to accommodate thick socks, and my toes can wiggle freely in them. I do not trip because of the slight extra length, either. They keep my feet warm, give good grip when climbing up or down mountain sides. They are used for camping, I am not a trekker, but I do get out and around while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Marta SolitaireTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: GOOD BOOT!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great boot for day hikers and 2-3 day hikers (that's all I've done). I had a little problem on the first day with one of my left toe going numb, but that subsided. They run SLIGHTLY large. I would not go down a size, but maybe try a half size down if you can. If you need them for a upcoming trip, I would order two then send one back that didn't fit best. I'm very happy with this purchase overall!
customer_reviews.author: Annieo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear between a 9.5 and 10 in women's shoes. I purchased a 10, and they fit beautifully. I had major surgery on my left foot and was looking for comfort, and a high enough ankle for support. these do the trick. They are also cool for warmer weather. love these!
customer_reviews.author: LovetoShop61

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit & Perfectly Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a hiking vacation that I’ll be taking next month, but wanted to “break them in” only that is unnecessary. From the first time I put them on and wore them to do yard work, they have fit perfectly and cradled my plantar fasciitis feet so that there is no pain. I liked mine so well that my husband ordered a pair too. He loves them just as much!
customer_reviews.author: CBerg

customer_reviews.title: OMG!  Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are my 3rd pair of Merrill hiking boots since middle age. I am now an elder with completely flat feet, and advanced bunions, making it quite difficult for me to find comfortable shoes. The previous pairs were darned good, but these are SO incredibly comfortable and stabilizing I actually look forward to putting them on. There was NO breaking in period, and they look great! Yes, they are my daily "go to" shoes. The only regret I have is that I am no longer strong enough to test these wonderful boots out on a hike with my husband.
customer_reviews.author: CorZilla7

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The toe box of these boots is comfortably wide. I have a bunion and my feet feel great in these. Good stability in the sole, but not horribly stiff. Good ankle support. I have walked about 2+ miles per day in them to break them in and they have been nothing except comfortable. I am looking forward to getting a lot of good wear from them.
customer_reviews.author: StargirlGA

customer_reviews.title: Its a Merrell!!
customer_reviews.text: the most comfortable boot I have ever worn. My doctor always says, "wear Merrells" because of foot problems I have. He is right, these are the best, most comfortable, no roll on the heel shoes ever. I have room for thick fluffy socks and my orthotic insole. Highly recommend Merrell shoes and these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best for multiple foot damage conditions
customer_reviews.text: This is my Go-To everyday boot - My Orthopedic surgeon approved. Accommodates ankle fracture, prescription orthotics, wide foot, flat arches, broken toes, pronation. Have purchased multiple pairs, nice to find on Amazon, usually better price than Zappo’s. Beware—This what you need after decades of wearing beautiful pointy high heels every day.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Heavenly boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are wonderful. I ave wide feet size 9. I ordered a 9.5 wide tho I could have stayed at 9. I also have large calves, so I only tied them to the first top hook, not the very top. I wore them for a day around the house and then did a 5 mile hike up and down hilly woods in them. Wonderfull! No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: M Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my feet and yet love to walk and hike. These boots are perfect for me. They have great arch support and are lightweight. The ankle support is good. I’ve worn them on several hikes and they have performed beautifully. Even on rocky trails that I’d normally slip on. So grateful I found them.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Etgen

customer_reviews.title: Nice light hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Have hiked around 10 miles in these boots so far. No break in period required. Decent arch support but I did need to add an additional, small arch support for my flat feet. Have kept my feet warm and dry in light snow and mud. When the temperature warms up I will test how these boots dry out after getting wet....the main reason for getting them.
customer_reviews.author: Diatom

customer_reviews.title: These boots are super comfortable for hiking!!
customer_reviews.text: Traveled to Yellowstone National Park for a vacation and was nervous about the terrain. We did a couple of hikes and I have to say these boots were perfect! The support was excellent, even on a 7-10 mile hike. And they are very light weight so my legs did not get tired.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. And, a great fit! I wear a 9 and have narrow feet but usually buy shoes in a medium width as a narrow shoe is usually too snug, By doing this, I do take a chance on shoes being too wide. In this case the shoes are roomy, but not too wide. I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I like these hikers. Dry quick and can take what you dish out! However they could be better if the insoles had some cushioning. I had to purchase inserts first time ever on any hiking boot I've purchased. Well worth the money if your looking for durability. Comfort not so much.
customer_reviews.author: properph

customer_reviews.title: They are fine for people that don't like some kind of cushion for the insole and don't have wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Even though I bought the size 10, they were tight across my toes. There was no cushioning whatsoever. I like the style, but I was disappointed that they weren't comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal K. Inman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were perfect right out of the box. I put them on and took a 2 mile walk down a rocky road. They were so comfortable and stable. I am in a very hot and humid area and have not felt too hot in the Moab boot. I am very happy with these and would not hesitate to purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: catrob

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, firm support around ankle
customer_reviews.text: Attractive light weight hiking boots with mesh inserts. Hiking boots are going to be hot, but the mesh seems to help a bit. I have worn these on two neighborhood walks to start breaking them in, each about 4 miles, and they seem to be comfortable with no real "breaking in" necessary. They are sturdy and firm around the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Vanda

customer_reviews.title: Like these but.......
customer_reviews.text: So love the color! Size is spot on.plenty of toe room.HOWEVER the right shoe has a very high arch support that feels like wadding.i had 2 other people try these boots on without telling them anything.same conclusion, something is wrong on the right arch.going 2 send this pair back and re order
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made for a women's foot.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for boots to replace my beloved MONTRAILS. I don't want mens boots that have been shrunk down, I wanted a women specific boot. They have a narrow heel with a wide toe box. My street shoe size is 7 and I purchased both the 7-1/2 and 8. If you wear a heavy sock, you may consider 1 whole size up. Otherwise the 1/2 size up works well. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: IdaMayB

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY FEET as soon as you put them on.
customer_reviews.text: I wear custom made orthotics in my shoes so I can't really comment about arch support. I have been having trouble finding shoes that work for a problem I am having with my left inside ankle. Since these are boots instead of "shoes" these shoes are 5 starts for me because I get additional support on the inside ankle that I don't get from shoes. The minute I put these boots on they felt like heaven to my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Doris Drommond Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Boots
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 7.5 and I ordered a size 8 after reading previous reviews and they fit me great. Not so tight that I can choose to wear thin or thicker socks this way. The tread is really good and even after walking near a large waterfall, getting drenched, I never slipped on the rocks or in the mud.
customer_reviews.author: TkB

customer_reviews.title: Pret-a-hiking | no breaking-in required
customer_reviews.text: The reviewers were right! The shoes didn’t need a break-in period. The only thing I would advise is to wear socks that cover the ankle to avoid blistering. Hiking in these bad boys as compared to standard sneakers was day and night. The support and stability provided let me actually enjoy what I was doing more and worry about twisting and ankle not-at-all. Also, I meant to order the wide, glad I didn’t as I’m borderline and the shoes fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Aldina Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time buying such expensive hiking boots, and just the arch support is enough to make a huge difference. With my other shoes, I can get hip pain after a long walk. NOT WITH THIS PAIR. My feet feel supported. Its seems to support my knees too. Very high quality shoes!
customer_reviews.author: PastaBatman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried them on and walked around my living room but they are very comfortable. I bought my normal size 7 and they fit perfect. I have very high arches and have trouble finding shoes that meet my arch without insoles. These have great medial arch support. They do make your foot look short and wide but happy with them especially since they were on sale for <$80.
customer_reviews.author: LCB

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, durable and I like them.
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was more padding on the back of the heel. But, overall I like the great durability and ruggedness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerJoy Strouse

customer_reviews.title: Shoe too short for size 7
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 7W women's shoe the donut hole of the shoe world. I also need orthotic arch support. The shoe fit perfectly the arch support was proper the width perfect only to have my toes hit the end of the shoe painfully. The toe box is too short for a size 7. Getting a half size up is a nightmare scenario for fitting size 7W because it never works. Now, I have to figure out how to send the shoes back. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome hiking boots. Unfortunately I had to return them because I ordered the wrong size, but they are well made and very comfortable, supportive boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Good for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new pair of these same boots every year and wear them for nearly all of my walking/hiking. They are good for plantar fasciitis and hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: tfarmer

customer_reviews.title: I had to order 1 1/2 size larger for enough room for hiking socks.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these shoes, but had to get 1 1/2 size larger for proper fit with hiking socks. Didn't need to break in. Went hiking for 2 hours on a rocky, desert uphill/downhill trail and my feet were so comfortable and didn't hurt later. Good traction also. Like I said, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for light ankle support during light to moderate hiking. I have yet to be disappointed with Merrell. Fits perfect & enough room to wear thicker sock for early Spring & late Fall hikes. These were cheaper than the Moab 2 waterproof/resistant boot & I can waterproof them myself.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa Stouffer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and not too heavy. I love the way these boots fit, the support is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Bringgold

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot. True to size
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I’ve been shopping around for a good pair of hiking boots and have always been told you can’t go wrong with merrell. They are very comfortable so far. I don’t think they will need much breaking in. I did try them on in person before buying online and they fit as expected. I was told I might want to size up a half size or so for socks and insoles but I’m not finding that necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots were exactly as shown. I wear hiking socks with them and have no comfort issues. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Carson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing him
customer_reviews.text: These are the best hiking boots! I wear a 8-81/2 and a wide toe box. The 8/12 fit perfect with hiking socks. I wore them right out of the box for a 5 hour hike in hot weather. They are the best hiking boots!! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Seattle sleeper

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, very good arch support.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are SO SO comfortable! I'ts amazing! I spend 10 hrs./day walking/standing on concrete floors at work, and these support my lets and feet very well!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and supportive.
customer_reviews.text: So comfy! Returned the Ontario by Merrell and got these. Very happy with this decision. Great arch support and they are very comfortable. I wore for a hike in New York and had no discomfort whatsoever afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Sfp21

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot. I have a very wide foot. Often, wide widths don't fit. I was ASTONISHED at how well this boot fit even with socks. Hiked in the mountains for hours in great comfort. The touch of purple is perfect. This nearly 60 year old woman is ordering another pair. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Foster

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I hike and scramble 3-5 times weekly year round in Red Rock here in Las Vegas. My go to boots. No need for breaking them in. Comfy from first wear. Wish the lasted longer than 10 months though.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Cool Summer Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: Most hiking boots are made to be waterproof, which can make them too hot for summer hiking. I seldom hike in the rain, so the waterproofing is helpful for wet trails, but as breathability is more important to me, I tried these. These ventilators live up to their name & are a sturdy, attractive boot. Larger toe box works for wider feet.
customer_reviews.author: Louise A. Raimondo

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: No need to break these in-my 3rd pair. I have waterproof, not waterproof and now with vents and could not be happier
customer_reviews.author: Julie Kindel

customer_reviews.title: Out of the Box perfect
customer_reviews.text: I did a ot of review reading before buying these, and a men's pair for my husband, I love them, they do not need to be broke in, but I have been wearing them to do my nightly walks getting use to them for my hiking trip. very light, comfy. I might try to find some that are like regular shoes. I love the ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Fit.  Best to measure your foot to ensure sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Was a good online purchase as sizing can be tricky. Return is easy. Delivery is timely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not breathable
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really like these shoes. One just can't go wrong with Merrell's. They're very comfortable for all day wear. The only downfall is they're a bit too warm. They're not as breathable as I initially thought they would be.
customer_reviews.author: J.M

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Boots Out There
customer_reviews.text: I have weak ankles so I need a shoe with good support. Merrill hiking boots with Vibram sole are the very best I have been able to find and I’ve tried a lot of other brands. Shipment arrived as promised with no delays.
customer_reviews.author: Kxyfan

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, very comfortable, sturdy support
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are sturdy, good looking, and provide substantial support. I have not tried them out yet on a hike, but am impressed with the comfort of a short walk. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dailyreader

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and supportive!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable! My feet usually ache really bad after a hike. After wearing these I can do 9 mile hikes in the mountains and my feet feel great! I did. Not have to wear in either.
customer_reviews.author: lisagna

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots ever!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these hiking boots. No break in period needed. Super lightweight yet they feel very durable. Dry very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Keli

customer_reviews.title: Not a good boot!
customer_reviews.text: The most uncomfortable hiking boot Ive ever tried to wear. This is my last pair of Merrells I will ever buy. The quality is nothing like the past 10 years I have been happy with Merrells.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My first Merrell boot and I was not disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I always wear Merrells for hiking but this was my 1st boot. They took some getting used to but didnt take long at all to break them in and I love them! Very comfortable. Will continue to be a loyal customer for Merrell's brand shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Candice L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning hikers!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots! I bought them for a half day hike in Korea, so my first time wearing I was worried I would have sore feet and blisters but not the case! Good arch support and ankle support, kept my feet warm and dry, with no slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee R.

customer_reviews.title: black toe kick looks weird
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are well made. The size felt a little small with some pressure on the toes. The black toe kicker that wraps around the front made my feet look small and stumpy. I wish they would bring back the Accentor, which was a great hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: I'm searching for good hiking mid ht boots for 2 week Camino
customer_reviews.text: Was undecided whether to keep shoe as it seemed to fit properly and well made. But felt clunky and thick around ankles. May be too warm for my needs. Ran out of time to try others so sent it back. I'm searching for good hiking mid ht boots for 2 week Camino. If I can't find anything better I may reorder this.
customer_reviews.author: Amac

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and great. Highly recommend. Exchanged the stiffer waterproof version for this one, and it is very comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: pressure across tops of toes
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this particular shoe several times, and they have been very comfortable "out of the box". This pair, however, is quite uncomfortable, there must have been a production change? The ankles are stiffer and rub, and they are tight and uncomfortable over the toes creating pressure. I'm back to wearing my old ones for any hikes of distance. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kral

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: After a broken bone in my foot and surgery - I realized that my other Merrell shoes were not wide enough. I got these shoes in wide and it made a huge difference and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: SLJ

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room in toes but did not support my arch.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room in toes but did not support my arch. I didn't like the lacing at the top, couldn't make it tight enough. I did buy a 1/2 size up but they didn't feel too big so don't think that was reason couldn't tighten - has a lot of tongue padding.
customer_reviews.author: cindy w

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am hard on shoes, on feet all day and usually shoes only last 6 months but these last me a year and they are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Maricia

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable high top ever. This is my second pair. I’m not a skinny person and this shoe provides a lot of support.
customer_reviews.author: Nanna Debra

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Boot. Comfy immediately!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a lightweight rugged everyday boot. This is the one. The break in time is almost instant. Super comfortable. Buy a pair. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: dubya

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, really comfy
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Wore them hiking for 3 straight days and were really comfortable. The first day I needed a little moleskin on the back of my ankle area above the heel, but that didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up or wide for bunion
customer_reviews.text: Love ❤️ this boot, I have the regular hiking shoe version, but need an ankle top. The 7.5 is too tight on my bunion. Returning and ordering the wide.
customer_reviews.author: Theworks

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I'm wearing them even as I write these words. Very comfortable ,great looking hiking boots. Can't wait to hit the trail with these!
customer_reviews.author: Crone

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy, and high performance boots
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good-fitting, sturdy hiking boot that performed well on all terrain. This hiking boot is amazing! Grips the trail—rocky, dirt , steep— almost like it suctions to the ground. I have been able to hike longer and further with these boots. Highly recommend them! Well worth the $$$
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really good hiking boots ! Just in case they disappear from production I decided to buy in two different colors ...
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Performed as expected after break in period.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to stretch the ankle area a bit as it rubbed the ankle bone uncomfortably. After that break-in adjustment, the boots performed as expected and did keep feet dry on week long hiking trip in light snow/slush conditions. Had to use light weight sock as fit was a bit snug in toe box even with laces adjusted . My foot is definitely wide though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and feel great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a hiking trip to the Grand Canyon. They feel great- and are perfect for a beginner hiker. I would ask a professional hiking guide for boot recommendations before buying a pair for an extended backpacking trip- but for a day hike these were spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Katie T Collins

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this hiking boot. Ventilated as advertised, comfortable right out of the box. Fit as expected. Taking them it to CO and UT for backpacking, and they get regular use on the trails here in MO.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Kardell

product_meta.title: Merrell Women's Moab 2 Vent Mid Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Experience out-of-the-box comfort in this ventilated hiker. With durable leathers, a supportive foot-bed, and Vibram traction, all in a versatile package,you won't doubt why moab stands for mother-of-all-boots.
feature_bullets: Performance suede leather and mesh upper
Bellows, closed-cell foam tongue keeps moisture and debris out
Merrell M Select FIT.ECO+ blended EVA contoured footbed with added zonal arch and heel support
